info.title: Fluid APIs
info.description: The **Fluid APIs** provides a comprehensive set of APIs designed to integrate Fluid's powerful services into your applications seamlessly. This bundle offers robust functionality for enhancing messaging solutions, streamlining data management, and improving customer interactions. With detailed documentation, secure authentication, and flexible integration options, the Fluid Public API Bundle is engineered to help you leverage our services efficiently and effectively, unlocking new potentials and achieving greater connectivity within your systems.

port.description: The port number for local development

get.description: This endpoint retrieves the list of products for the company. Response includes an array with details of products and their associated variants, variant_countries (pricing in different countries), collections, and images.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language code of the desired language. If not specified, the company's default language is used. Can be upper case or lower case. Uses [2 letter ISO language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes)

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The country code for specifying the country. The currency and pricing will change depending on the country selected. If not specified, the company's default country is used. Uses [2 letter ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes) (e.g. 'us', 'ca', 'es', 'fr'). Can be upper case or lower case.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the products. Available statuses are ['active', 'draft', 'archived', 'all']. If not specified, the default status is 'active'.

parameters.name: category_title
parameters.description: Case-sensitive title of category to filter by. Retrieves all products that are included in the specified category and sub categories. Do not use if using category_id.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: ID of category to filter by. Retrieves all products that are included in the specified category and sub categories. Do not use if using category_title.

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: Filter for the availability of the product. If not specified, the default is 'all'.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Filter by a collection or multiple collections. See the Collections API for more information.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specify how the results are ordered. Available values are ['title', 'price', 'cv', 'created_at']. Add 'asc' or 'desc' to specify direction (defaults to 'asc'). If not specified, default order is 'PRIORITY DESC'. Use the send_to_top API to set highest priority.

post.description: Create a new Product with associated variants, variant_countries (pricing in different countries), collections, and images.

sku.description: The default SKU for the product. You can add more variants with their SKU after product is created.

image_url.description: A URL for the default image

country_code.description: 2 letter ISO country code (e.g. 'us', 'ca', 'es', 'fr'). Can be upper case or lower case.

price.description: The price in the currency determined by country_code

description.description: Rich text description of the product, including HTML

feature_text.description: Detailed information about the product, like tech specs or nutrition information. Rich text, including HTML.

category_id.description: The id of the category to assign to the product

subscription_price.description: The recurring monthly price (if the product is a subscription)

public.description: Whether the product is available to the public

in_stock.description: If false, product won't be available for purchase unless keep_selling is true

keep_selling.description: Allow selling items that are on backorder (out of stock)

no_index.description: If true, tells search engines not to include this product/page in search results

get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific Product.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Product ID or slug to retrieve the product details

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: ISO 639-1 language code for the desired language (e.g., 'en', 'es', 'fr')

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for pricing and currency (e.g., 'us', 'ca', 'es', 'fr')

post.description: Assigns a product to a specified collection.

parameters.description: The ID of the product to assign to a collection

parameters.description: The ID of the product to remove from the collection

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: The ID of the collection from which to remove the product

patch.description: Changes the priority of a product to the highest level, moving it to the top of the default product listing order.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product to be moved to top priority

post.description: Make a copy of an existing product.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the product to duplicate

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: External identifier of the product to find

get.description: Retrieves the list of collections.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Filter collections by their public attribute

get.description: Retrieves a list of categories with optional filtering and hierarchy options.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Retrieve sub-categories from their parent category id. Default retrieves only root-level categories.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Filter categories by their public attribute

parameters.name: include_children
parameters.description: Include sub-categories organized underneath another category

parameters.name: source_type
parameters.description: The type of objects the categories are related to

post.description: Create a new category in the system.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title for the category

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the category

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: A URL for the category's display image

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position for sorting categories (ascending order)

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Flag to make the category public or private

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: ID of the parent category for creating hierarchical relationships

parameters.name: source_type
parameters.description: The type of object the category relates to

get.description: Retrieves a Category object.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id for the category

parameters.name: include_children
parameters.description: Include any sub-categories organized underneath another category

patch.description: Update an existing category's details including its title, description, image, position, visibility, parent category, and source type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the category to update

put.description: Updates a specific shopping cart with new information including customer details, items, totals, shipping options, and other cart-related data.

parameters.name: cart_token
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the cart to be updated

tags.name: Tiles
tags.description:
Tiles are a crucial feature in our [admin portal](https://www.fluid.app/tiles), designed to facilitate Single Sign On (SSO) flows for users within the app. Each Tile represents a redirecting button within the user's app that links to a specific URL, with the addition of a temporary authorization token (auth_token) as a parameter.

Here's how the process works:

1. In the admin portal, a new Tile is created. Each Tile is essentially a shortcut to a specific URL, such as `https://www.example.com`.
2. The Tile appears in the user's app interface as a button, featuring a representative image. This makes it easy for users to identify and access.
3. When an authorized User clicks on the Tile in app, an authorization token (auth_token) is generated and appended to the URL as a parameter. For example, `https://www.example.com?auth_token=ABC123`.
4. When the user clicks on the Tile (button), they are automatically redirected to the URL embedded in the Tile, carrying the `auth_token` along.
5. The user's browser then visits the URL, and the `auth_token` is passed to the link.
6. The [User Show API endpoint](https://developer.fluid.app/#8bb91014-54e9-423b-92df-31befb2239ae) accepts the `auth_token` to fetch the user's details. This data can be utilized to automatically sign the user into their account, eliminating the need for manual login. Alternatively, it can be used to generate an app-in-an-app experience where the user navigates within a portion of your app as an authenticated user.
    

This Tile functionality streamlines the user experience, granting a smoother navigation process and easing user access with a Single Sign On (SSO) flow.

Note: `auth_token` expires after 30 minutes.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhook Events are generated by some Fluid resources when certain actions  
are completed, such as the creation of an order, abandonment of cart, or  
the deactivation of an user. By requesting events, your app can know  
when certain actions have occurred in the fluid.

[Webhook Overview](#webhooks)

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Manage and track system events that occur within the application. Events provide a way to monitor and respond to various activities and state changes.

tags.name: Custom Pages
tags.description: Create and manage custom pages within the application. Custom pages allow you to build unique, branded experiences and content areas tailored to your needs.

tags.name: Libraries
tags.description: Manage reusable components and resources that can be shared across your application. Libraries help maintain consistency and reduce duplication in your implementation.

tags.name: ProductRedirects
tags.description: Handle product URL redirects to maintain SEO value and ensure proper routing when product URLs change or products are moved within your catalog.

tags.name: Variants
tags.description: Manage product variants including different sizes, colors, or other attributes that define unique versions of a product.

tags.name: Media
tags.description: Handle media assets such as images, videos, and documents that are used throughout the application. Includes functionality for upload, storage, and delivery of media content.

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description:
Conversations within Fluid's platform serve as the central hub where users, contacts and/or automated agents (such as Response Bots and Broadcast Bots) come together to exchange messages. Each conversation can include multiple participants, ranging from individual users to bots designed to provide interactive support or broadcast important updates. With a flexible architecture, Conversations allow for rich interactions, whether it’s real-time messaging, automated responses, or large-scale broadcasts.

The structure supports seamless communication, enabling participants to share information effectively while allowing developers to build and extend features like bots that can respond, broadcast, or even act as virtual assistants within any conversation.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description:
Messages are the core units of communication within Fluid’s platform, facilitating interactions between participants in a conversation. Each message can originate from either a user or a contact or an automated bot, allowing for dynamic exchanges ranging from simple text messages to more complex data payloads.

Messages support various use cases, whether it's delivering personalized responses via Response Bots, broadcasting announcements from Broadcast Bots, or regular user-to-user communication. The flexible structure of messages ensures that they can be tailored to suit different needs, providing a robust foundation for real-time interaction, automation, and seamless integration within the broader conversation framework.
